title: Marriage Licenses For Some In Kansas
teaser: Gay couples in some counties in Kansas can now get their marriage licenses - but not without a struggle.
contentencoded:
Getting a marriage license could be as easy as walking into a courthouse with an I.D. and a credit card. Not true for same-sex couples in Kansas who had their first full day of marriage rights yesterday – at least in some of the state’s counties.

For one couple, the first step was a maze of jurisdictions and judges and ultimately, justice.

“From the Here & Now Contributors Network, Peggy Lowe of KCUR has the story.”

We hear from the Here & Now Contributors Network, KCUR’s Peggy Lowe with the story.

  • Read more on this story via KCUR.

Guest

  • Peggy Lowe, reporter at KCUR in Kansas City. She tweets @peggyllowe.
